channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Strong winds breaking dead and living branches off tree, 13th October
item.description:
Have seen trees being pruned around the borough but have never seen any attention given to the very mature oak trees at the bottom of Mead Way. When there are strong winds there are always dead branches broken off and landing on grass and pavement and during storm Amy it was living branches. Concerned about adults and children getting hit by these branches as they fall. Particularly concerned about the oaks on the even side.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Mead Way, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned scaffolding on building next to “fuckoffee” cafe on Bermondsey street, 12th October
item.description:
Abandoned scaffolding seems to have been in place for years with no work being carried out. This has resulted in litter, weeds and debris being dumped within it and causing a mess. Please tell building management to remove the scaffolding and tidy up the area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 153, Tower Bridge Road, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Antisocial behaviour being caused by line bikes. Weekends are the worst over 28 line bikes dumped all over the place even leaning on residents, visitors vehicles causing damaged to their cars because bikes of being left in dangerous, inconsiderate way. What is the mayor of Hackney doing about this nuisance and anti-social behavior with these line bikes everywhere. I live in the area and I have motability issues, disabled and often have to try move lime bikes off my car or out the way. Lime bikes laying in public roads causing a hazard to other road users., 12th October
item.description:
Antisocial behaviour line bikes. Why is the mayor and authority not addressing these issues is it because mayor and authority are getting a big chunk of money from the investment company line bike and leasing bays two company.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Semley Gate, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Dumped TV, cushions, clothes and general junk. Was strewn across this area this morning and then tidied into a heap by the street-sweeper. Much of this waste appears linked to the vagrancy issue that has arisen at this site in recent weeks

item.title: Kenilworth Rd - outside Coronation Court (near junction with Willesden Lane), 12th October
item.description:
Enormous flytip. Fridge, cabinets, clothes, DIY waste and general rubbish. Pavement completely obstructed. Reported multiple times over the last week by myself and others. All equally appalled that Brent Council have not cleared this sooner, which has encouraged further dumping at this side. Shame on those who have done this and shame on Brent Council for not having dealt with this sooner

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kenilworth Road, London

item.description:

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unconfined active construction site with open trenches and construction materials scattered., 12th October
item.description:
The whole length of Beak St was not properly fenced, protected or signed. Pedestrians clambering over open trenches. Construction materials scattered. Accident waiting to happen. Called the Compass Infrastructure emergency phone and got the auto operator with options. Pressed 5 to report an emergency. Engaged. All afternoon. Tried all the other options. All continuously engaged. Given the proximity to one of the UK's premium tourist assets it was a disgraceful display of poor construction and a health and safety hazard. I am in construction and I have never seen such a bad live site in the UK. UKPN and Compass need to be called out about this urgently.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 35, Beak Street, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continuous Parking Issue!, 12th October
item.description:
There is a continuous and problematic parking issue on Bourneside Gardens and a safety concern on Primrose Close. There are not enough parking spaces for residents on Bourneside Gardens. Residents and visitors are struggling to park, and vehicles are now parking on grass verges and tight spaces between houses, especially at turning points. This blocks access for others trying to enter or leave their homes and prevents people from turning around. A large silver van is parked long-term and rarely moves. Another work van belonging to a resident at 10 Bourneside Gardens (We believe the tenant is subletting) is parked daily and purposely takes up two spaces adding to the issue. These vehicles are taking up much-needed space. Parking permits were previously considered but shelved – I strongly request that permits are reconsidered to prioritise residents. On Primrose Close, there is a white Ford Transit Van (Reg: RO65 CDZ) that has been parked for around six months. A man is living in it. The van has no MOT or tax and he is using gas canisters inside, creating a serious safety risk. It is also impacting the appearance of the area. Please investigate and take appropriate action on both matters. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bourneside Gardens, Southend, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Weeds : Brambles by river ornamental gardens need cutting back, 12th October
item.description:
The weeds and brambles by the beech trees and all around the river / ornimental gardens area needs cutting back they are taking over the lovely plants wrapping around the plants and trees . Friends of Brooks Way maintain these gardens every weekend in a small area but it’s to much for them to do it all it needs council gardeners to cut these back now

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brook Way, St Paul's Cray, London

item.title: Near International Journal of Excellence in Research, Bloomsbury Way, London WC1A 2SE, 12th October
item.description:
I am writing to make you aware and request urgent Repair of a seriously defective manhole cover located at the junction of Bloomsbury Way and Bury Place, WC1A, near our home. Over recent weeks, the manhole cover has become loose. Each time a vehicle passes over it, it emits a loud clattering sound - so forceful that our house vibrates. The noise is especially bad in the evenings and overnight, when buses frequently pass (often every 5 minutes). It genuinely feels like a train rolling by. The disturbance is severe: it wakes us and our 15-year-old daughter nearly every night. This is not just a nuisance - it is disrupting our sleep, affecting our health and wellbeing, and I believe it also presents a safety concern (a loose cover might worsen further under constant load).
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bury Place, Bloomsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Noisy manhole two months!!, 12th October
item.description:
The manhole is loose and super NOISY for the last two months. I have called and reported it before. I made videos from the street when you can hear how loud it is and also from my apartment Which is exactly outside on the 5th floor and it’s still VERY LOUD every time a car drives through it you listen it twice from the front and back wheel!! Please make your arrangements and come fix it… Just outside the triangular island and on the pink building, Grays Inn Buildings , is a small rectangular manhole , there are two one of them is super noisy!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rosebery Avenue, Holborn, London
Report on FixMyStreet
